model_answer: The answer is C: [00:01:39 - 00:02:22]. The video segment describes how Hubble has contributed to our understanding of exoplanets, including making the first direct visible-light image of an exoplanet in 2008. This achievement is noted in the timeline from 00:01:39 to 00:02:22.

The answer is C: [00:03:19 - 00:04:41]. The footage switches between infrared and visible views of a nebula at approximately 00:03:38, as indicated by the tag "Infrared" appearing on the screen. The narrator then discusses how Hubble can study the birth, life, and death of stars and peer through thick clouds in star-forming regions.
